text: Not to spam everyone with links, but at some point I heard you guys mention that you want to profile the code. I came across this webcast that might be useful: <https://portal.xsede.org/course-calendar/-/training-user/class/2310/session/3970>

text: Julia has some profiling tools apparently. Have you guys ever tried using them?

elements.text: Julia has some profiling tools apparently. Have you guys ever tried using them?

text: I’ve fiddled but no serious effort. Not sure if they work for GPU though… might need to use nvidia’s tools? Ali did some profiling long ago at an nvidia hackathon at MIT.

elements.text: I’ve fiddled but no serious effort. Not sure if they work for GPU though… might need to use nvidia’s tools? Ali did some profiling long ago at an nvidia hackathon at MIT.

text: Yeah I've only used the built-in tools to do some basic CPU profiling and find where memory allocations are happening.

elements.text: Yeah I've only used the built-in tools to do some basic CPU profiling and find where memory allocations are happening.

text: For GPU profiling we had to use Nvidia tools but it's been a long time

elements.text: For GPU profiling we had to use Nvidia tools but it's been a long time

text: The course I posted uses an nvidia tool called nsight I think

text: Was that the one you used?

text: Ah I remember using `nvprof` but looks like it's getting deprecated in favor of Nsight: <https://docs.nvidia.com/cuda/profiler-users-guide/index.html#migrating-to-nsight-tools>
